channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strike in Syria, killing leader tied to deadly Islamic State ambush
item.description: A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.
item.content:encoded:
A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Saudi-UAE rift is turning two close allies into regional rivals
item.description: The key question now is whether the Saudi-UAE rift settles back into business as usual or accelerates into a wider realignment, says Marc Lynch, professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.
item.content:encoded: The key question now is whether the Saudi-UAE rift settles back into business as usual or accelerates into a wider realignment, says Marc Lynch, professor of political science and international affairs at George Washington University.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Trump says 8 EU countries to be charged 10% tariff for opposing US control of Greenland
item.description: In a post on social media, Trump said a 10% tariff will take effect on Feb. 1, and will climb to 25% on June 1 if a deal is not in place for the United States to purchase Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
In a post on social media, Trump said a 10% tariff will take effect on Feb. 1, and will climb to 25% on June 1 if a deal is not in place for the United States to purchase Greenland.

(Image credit: Emil Helms)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'Not for sale': massive protest in Copenhagen against Trump's desire to acquire Greenland
item.description: Thousands of people rallied in Copenhagen to push back on President Trump's rhetoric that the U.S. should acquire Greenland.
item.content:encoded:
Thousands of people rallied in Copenhagen to push back on President Trump's rhetoric that the U.S. should acquire Greenland.

(Image credit: EMIL HELMS/Ritzau Scanpix/AFP via Getty Ima)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Uganda's longtime leader declared winner in disputed vote
item.description: Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.
item.content:encoded:
Museveni claims victory in Uganda's contested election as opposition leader Bobi Wine goes into hiding amid chaos, violence and accusations of fraud.

(Image credit: Luis TATO)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: The latest on what's happening in Ukraine
item.description: Many residents in Kyiv are suffering through freezing temperatures with no heat or electricity after Russian strikes on energy infrastructure.
item.content:encoded: Many residents in Kyiv are suffering through freezing temperatures with no heat or electricity after Russian strikes on energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: A protester from Iran shares her experience
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with A., an Iranian who recently left the country after participating in several days of protests.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon speaks with A., an Iranian who recently left the country after participating in several days of protests.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: What a visit to a French clown school reveals about clowning
item.description: A visit to the Gaulier clown school - home to alumni including Sacha Baron Cohen and Emma Thompson - reveals that clowning is all about the art of failure.
item.content:encoded: A visit to the Gaulier clown school - home to alumni including Sacha Baron Cohen and Emma Thompson - reveals that clowning is all about the art of failure.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Iran's supreme leader acknowledges thousands killed as pressure builds on clerical rule
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei acknowledged that "thousands" have been killed in protests that began in late December. But he put the blame on President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei acknowledged that "thousands" have been killed in protests that began in late December. But he put the blame on President Trump.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
item.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

(Image credit: Sean Kilpatrick)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
